intro: Cousinia ambigens, commonly known as the ambiguous globemallow, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Polygonaceae, which includes plants known for their distinctive leaf shapes and often colorful flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in arid or semi-arid environments. Its flowers are small and clustered in dense, spherical inflorescences, giving it a unique appearance. Cousinia ambigens is often found in alpine meadows and is adapted to withstand cold temperatures and strong winds.
